timeline.author: joheriks

timeline.bodyText: Is element parameter needed? Seems it could be omitted as this is always called with argument this.element.
timeline.author: joheriks

timeline.bodyText:
I got an NPE here when using the attribute-without-value syntax in my template. For example autofocus:
<vaadin-text-field id="textField" autofocus></vaadin-text-field>
Also, how about about ${...} in the attribute? For example:
<vaadin-text-field id="textField" label="${this.dynamicLabel}"></vaadin-text-field>
Should it then also not be read to the server side?
timeline.author: joheriks

replies.bodyText:
label="${this.dynamicLabel}" should not be read as it's dynamic.
But now again : how may I detect a dynamic values ?
Is label="foo ${this.dynamicLabel}" a correct declaration ?
Is check for ${ presence good enough ?
I considered only bindings as dynamic value and missed that .
replies.author: denis-anisimov

replies.bodyText:
There is an IT test for hidden attribute .
So stacktrace is required.
replies.author: denis-anisimov

replies.bodyText:
Probably attributes should only be parsed to server if they're string, int, float, etc. literals. So value containing ${ would need to be excluded.
With the following template in my app (./src/polymer.js):
class PolymerComponent extends PolymerElement {
  static get template() {
    return html`
        <vaadin-text-field id="textField" autofocus></vaadin-text-field>
    `;
  }
}
customElements.define('polymer-component', PolymerComponent);
Java:
@Tag("polymer-component")
@JsModule("./src/polymer.js")
public class PolymerComponent extends PolymerTemplate<PolymerComponent.PolymerModel> {
    public interface PolymerModel extends TemplateModel {
    }

    @Id
    private TextField textField;

    public PolymerComponent() {
        System.out.println(textField.isAutofocus());
    }
}
I got the following exception when adding the component to MainView:

replies.author: joheriks

replies.bodyText:
Values with ${ are excluded.
Will check the exception, thanks.
replies.author: denis-anisimov
denis-anisimov

replies.bodyText:
On the other hand , apparently the NPE is caused by the null  attribute value after Jsoup parsing which is never null for me.
I may assume it's related to Jsoup version.
But anyway the fix should be easy: just check null  value.
replies.author: denis-anisimov

replies.bodyText: This template looks essentially the same as the one I posted above (I omitted the imports). I get the NPE also with this template I when I add the polymer component to a server-side component.
replies.author: joheriks

replies.bodyText: Both issues should be fixed now.
replies.author: denis-anisimov

timeline.message: Refactor injectable element initialization to reuse the logic
Set global attributes as attributes and not as properties

Set global attributes as attributes and not as properties

Conflicts:
	flow-server/src/main/java/com/vaadin/flow/component/polymertemplate/BundleParser.java

Refactor: distinguish injectable initializers for Polymer and Lit
Implement initialization for Lit templates
Check the attribute value for dynamic declaration

Refactor: distinguish injectable initializers for Polymer and Lit
Implement initialization for Lit templates
Check the attribute value for dynamic declaration

Add unit test for Lit template and correct the code

* Correct parser usage in CTORs
* Use boolean attribute
* Add headers for files
Add IT for Lit template attributes
Be aware of null attribute values.
Make Sonar happy: use prefix as a parameter in debug method
